alert.note: Alert for City of Fairfax; City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 12 at 6:52PM EDT until September 12 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following counties: City of Fairfax, City of Manassas, City of Manassas Park, Fairfax and Prince William. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dale City... Springfield... Fairfax... Mantua... Fort Belvoir... Woodbridge... Lake Ridge... Burke... Lorton... Franconia... Newington... Manassas... West Springfield... Manassas Park... Mount Vernon... Fairfax Station... Independent Hill... North Springfield... Ravensworth... Mason Neck... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Fairfax; City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Prince William
